title: Introduction to Java
subject: Java
theory:
Java is a popular high-level, class-based, object-oriented programming language designed to have as few implementation dependencies as possible.

It was created by James Gosling at Sun Microsystems (now Oracle) in 1995.

Key Philosophy: **Write Once, Run Anywhere (WORA)**. This means compiled Java code can run on all platforms that support Java without recompilation.

examples.explanation: Standard output command to print text to the console.

common_mistakes.correction: Java is case-sensitive. 'main' is different from 'Main'.

interview_questions.question: What is the main feature of Java?

real_world_use_cases.description: The majority of native Android applications are written in Java.

summary: Java is a robust, secure, and portable language that powers everything from mobile phones to enterprise servers.
